headings: Take your career in accounting to the next level.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
What Can You Do With a Master’s in Accounting Degree?
Why Earn My Accounting Master’s Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: In our comprehensive degree program, you will learn the knowledge and skills you need to meet the challenges faced by accounting professionals in today’s modern business world. You will also gain practical experience by interacting with business professionals, government and nonprofit agencies, and the advisors in our Small Business Development Center.
Our program is also designed to meet the requirements of the Texas State Board of Public Accountancy to sit for the Certified Public Accountant (CPA) Exam and earn your Texas CPA license.
The Norris-Vincent College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

Our professional faculty all have real-world accounting experience that they bring to the classroom. We also have several international faculty who offer you a world view of business, finance and accounting.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

There continues to be strong demand in Texas and across the U.S. for CPAs and in many other fields of business and finance. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that employment opportunities in these areas are expected to grow steadily through 2031, adding thousands of high-paying jobs.
Our graduates are prepared to start or advance their careers in public accountancy, auditing, budget analysis, fraud prevention and many other related fields.

Our small, in-person classes allow you to really get to know your professors and fellow students, ensuring you get the individual attention you deserve. Our professors also maintain extensive relationships with local accounting firms, businesses, nonprofits and government agencies to expand your opportunities for networking and professional development.

Since our program is geared to meet the CPA requirements in Texas, our students maintain an exemplary passing rate on the Texas CPA Exam. We annually rank in the top five among our peer universities, and among the top 10 overall in the state.

All of our students participate in internships to gain valuable hands-on experience prior to graduating. We also offer a course that allows you to participate in the annual San Angelo Small Business Plan Competition by advising the competitors. This type of practical experience may give you an advantage when applying for jobs or higher positions.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
